div.p: Stoneham Public Schools are now recognized as “Grief Sensitive Schools” thanks to the Grief Sensitive Schools Initiative (GSSI) from New York Life. A Grief-Sensitive School is an accredited K-12 public or private institution that commits to help provide a supportive environment for students who have experienced the death of a loved one. Presentations to school staff on key bereavement resources were led by New York Life ambassador Keith Antifonario and coordinated by The Stoneham Coalition for a Safe & Healthy Community to support the emotional well -being of Stoneham youth. Thank you to New York Life who awarded each Stoneham Public School with a $500 grant to help enhance their ability to offer grief support and resources.

p.strong: Raptor Memo to the Stoneham Community

br.br:
In the Fall of 2019, the Stoneham Public School District is implementing the Raptor Visitor Management System. This new system is part of the district's goal of improved school safety for students, staff, and our community.
To learn more about how Raptor will impact your visit to a Stoneham School, please see:
